Posts.Content: MissMyrtle wrote: As posted before, I was totally freaked when they told me that a baseline bone density showed patterns suggesting mets. I had the PET on Monday, got the results yesterday. Totally clean. I am so very relieved (and exhausted). Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: clean PET MissMyrtle bettysgirl

Posts.Content: MissMyrtle wrote: After surgery and receipt of the Oncotype results my oncologist recomended no chemo, a course of radiation and an armoatase inhibitor. i felt blessed. I was also relieved that the uncertainty was over. I was wrong. Last week I got a bone density test, a baseline prior to beginning the aromatase inhibitor soon after radiation is done. I didn't think much about it. They called me 2 days ago to tell me that the bone density showed a pattern suggesting metastatic disease. They said that the bone density test was not suitable for diagnosis of metastatic cancer so I need to go for a PET scan. I have to hang on until next week: test Monday morning, results on Tuesday. I haven't told my family because it is so uncertain, so strange. The PET will be definative. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Don't know which end is up MissMyrtle Leegr

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2007 05:54PM MissMyrtle wrote: Thanks for your kindness. I'm just going to try to not get too wigged out between now and when I get the results.
Posts.Title: Don't know which end is up MissMyrtle Leegr
